intro: Coniogramme lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf coniogramme, is a species of flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is often used in herbal remedies due to its mild aromatic properties. Coniogramme lanceolata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
